body_html:
I don't see an easy solution for this cycle, other than moving some functions to a new file.
For e.g. init_ops.py depends on:
linalg_ops.qr
linalg_ops.eye
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/init_ops.py

linalg_ops.qr can actually be accessed from gen_linalg_ops instead:
from tensorflow.python.ops import gen_linalg_ops
gen_linalg_ops.qr(...)

linalg_ops.eye is defined in linalg_ops.py. May be it can be moved to its own file? eye_op.py or linalg_ops_impl.py?

Then, init_ops.py can just depend on gen_linalg_ops and, say, eye_op.
eye_op.eye can be imported in linalg_ops.py, so that any other eye references would still work.

from tensorflow.python.ops import gen_linalg_ops
gen_linalg_ops.qr(...)
linalg_ops.eye is defined in linalg_ops.py. May be it can be moved to its own file? eye_op.py or linalg_ops_impl.py?
Then, init_ops.py can just depend on gen_linalg_ops and, say, eye_op.

body:
I don't see an easy solution for this cycle, other than moving some functions to a new file.
For e.g. init_ops.py depends on:
linalg_ops.qr
linalg_ops.eye
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/ops/init_ops.py

linalg_ops.qr can actually be accessed from gen_linalg_ops instead:
from tensorflow.python.ops import gen_linalg_ops
gen_linalg_ops.qr(...)

linalg_ops.eye is defined in linalg_ops.py. May be it can be moved to its own file? eye_op.py or linalg_ops_impl.py?

Then, init_ops.py can just depend on gen_linalg_ops and, say, eye_op.
eye_op.eye can be imported in linalg_ops.py, so that any other eye references would still work.
